parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the channel will be state-less command-only channel.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like "enabled") that is recognised as on/open state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to ON (OPEN respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: On/Open value
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: A number (like 0, -10) or a string (like "disabled") that is recognised as off/closed state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to OFF (CLOSED respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Off/Closed value
parameters.name: off

parameters.description: If you connect this channel to a Switch item and turn it on, color and saturation are preserved from the last state, but the brightness will be set to this configured initial brightness percentage.
parameters.label: Initial brightness
parameters.name: onBrightness

parameters.description: This channel will trigger on this MQTT topic. This topic can contain wildcards like + and # for example "all/in/#" or "sensors/+/config".
parameters.label: MQTT Topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An optional condition on the value of the MQTT topic that must match before this channel is triggered.
parameters.label: Payload condition
parameters.name: payload

parameters.description: The trigger channel payload usually only contains the received MQTT topic value. If you define a separator character, for example '#', the topic and received value will be in the trigger channel payload. For example: my_topic#my_received_value.
parameters.label: Separator character
parameters.name: separator

channel-types.description: This channel is triggered when a value is published to the configured MQTT topic on this broker connection. The event payload will be the received MQTT topic value.

A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: If your MQTT topic is limited to a set of one or more specific commands or specific states, define those states here. Separate multiple states with commas. An example for a light bulb state set: ON,DIMMED,OFF
parameters.label: Allowed states
parameters.name: allowedStates

parameters.description: Allows or disallows to use system pings next to the java integrated ping functionality. On windows the system ping works more reliable most of the time.

parameters.description: Pairing must be enabled to connect a new device. Pairing is automatically disabled after the configured pairing time (usually 60 seconds).

parameters.description: The Amazon echos have no means to recreate a new api key and they don't care about the 403-forbidden http status code. parameters.description: A number/dimmer channel can receive Increase/Decrease commands and computes the target number by adding or subtracting this delta value.
parameters.label: Delta value
parameters.name: step

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like "enabled") that is additionally recognised as on/open state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to ON (OPEN respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Custom On/Open value
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: A number (like 0, -10) or a string (like "disabled") that is additionally recognised as off/closed state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to OFF (CLOSED respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Custom Off/Closed value
parameters.name: off

parameterGroups.name: transformations
parameterGroups.label: Transform values
parameterGroups.description: These configuration parameters allow you to alter a value before it is published to MQTT or before a received value is assigned to an item.

parameters.description: HomeAssistant Object ID
parameters.label: Object ID
parameters.name: objectid

parameters.description: MQTT base prefix
parameters.label: MQTT base prefix
parameters.name: basetopic

parameters.description: Homie Device ID. This is part of the MQTT topic, e.g. "homie/deviceid/$homie".
parameters.label: Device ID
parameters.name: deviceid

parameters.description: MQTT base prefix
parameters.label: MQTT base prefix
parameters.name: basetopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the channel will be state-less command-only channel.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: This configuration represents the minimum of the allowed range. For a percentage channel that equals zero percent.
parameters.label: Absolute minimum
parameters.name: min

parameters.description: This configuration represents the maximum of the allowed range. For a percentage channel that equals one-hundred percent.
parameters.label: Absolute maximum
parameters.name: max

parameters.description: A number/dimmer channel can receive Increase/Decrease commands and computes the target number by adding or subtracting this delta value.
parameters.label: Delta value
parameters.name: step

item-types.label: Contact
item-types.description: Read-only status of contacts, e.g. door/window contacts.

item-types.label: Dimmer
item-types.description: Percentage value, typically used for dimmers

item-types.label: Group
item-types.description: Item to nest other items / collect them in groups

item-types.label: Player
item-types.description: Allows control of players (e.g. audio players)

item-types.label: Rollershutter
item-types.description: Roller shutter Item, typically used for blinds

item-types.label: Switch
item-types.description: Used for anything that needs to be switched ON and OFF

item-group-function-types.label: All state S1 ⊶ S1
item-group-function-types.description: If all members have state S1, this group has state S1 else state S2

item-group-function-types.label: Average
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the average of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Count
item-group-function-types.description: Sets the state to the number of members matching the given regular expression with their states.

params.label: Regex
params.description: A regular expression. '.*' for example would match all states.

item-group-function-types.label: Earliest
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the earliest of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Equal
item-group-function-types.description: Sets the group state to all members equal state otherwise to UNDEF

item-group-function-types.label: Latest
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the latest of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Maximum
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the maximum of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Minimum
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the minimum of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: All state S1 ⊶ S2
item-group-function-types.description: If all members have state S1, this group has state S2 else state S1

item-group-function-types.label: Any state S1 ⊶ S2
item-group-function-types.description: If any member is state S1, this group has state S2 else state S1

item-group-function-types.label: Any state S1 ⊶ S1
item-group-function-types.description: If any member is state S1, this group has state S1 else state S2

item-group-function-types.label: Sum
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the sum of all group members

persistence.label: MapDB Restore

persistence.label: MapDB Restore

persistence-services.description: This service allows you to persist state updates using the Amazon DynamoDB database.
persistence-services.label: Amazon DynamoDB Persistence

persistence-services.description: This service allows you to persist and query states using the InfluxDB time series database.
persistence-services.label: InfluxDB

persistence-services.description: This service allows you to persist state updates using a SQL or NoSQL database through the Java Persistence API
persistence-services.label: Java Persistence API

persistence-services.description: The mapdb Persistence Service is based on simple key-value store that only saves the last value. The intention is to use this for restoreOnStartup items because all other persistence options have their drawbacks if values are only needed for reload.
persistence-services.label: mapdb

persistence-services.description: rrd4j is a round-robin database and does not grow in size - it has a fixed allocated size, which is used. This is accomplished by doing data compression, which means that the older the data is, the less values are available. So while you might have a value every minute for the last 24 hours, you might only have one every day for the last year.
persistence-services.label: rrd4j

actions.description: Allows the execution of a user-defined script.
